page.title: 14A tale of two commuters
page.content: My dad works in Leicester and has to drive from Cossington daily. His journey takes him through fields and built up areas.Traffic jams are common and in the winter snow drifts can be a problem.As he drives he can smell factory fumes and crisps being fried at Walkers factory.In the fields he can some times smell fertiliser.In the summer he enjoys his journey. By James Wreglesworth age 11. My dad works in the B.U.Its on the outskirts of Leicester.He travels about 6 miles and uses the same route every day.He always goes down Platts Lane,up to the Red Lion pub and then on the A6.He is meant to work 7\ hours but he works 10.He leaves at about 8:15am and returns at 5:30pm.He enjoys driving in to work every day and likes living in Cossington because its quiet.By Tom Geary age 10.
